Articles.Content:
I have frequent crashes on this 1.0.5 install with a fair number of mods. I'd appreciate any advice. Thanks!

 

 

Output_log.txt, crash folder: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B4Rt7Cyo760PZXRKM1RyY0c4TlU/view?usp=sharing

 

Mod List:

 

KSP: 1.0.5 (Win32) - Unity: 4.6.4f1 - OS: Windows 7 Service Pack 1 (6.1.7601) 64bit
USI Tools - 0.7
Community Resource Pack - 0.5
Contract Configurator - 1.9.11
CC-CP-SCANSat - 0.6
Contract Pack: Bases and Stations - 3.1.5
Contract Reward Modifier - 1.0.2.1
Crowd Sourced Science - 3.0.2
CustomBarnKit - 1.1.4
DMagic Orbital Science - 1.2
CapCom Mission Control On The Go - 1.0.2
Firespitter - 7.1.5
Interstellar Fuel Switch - 1.18
RasterPropMonitor - 0.24.2
Kerbal Engineer Redux - 1.0.19.4
Kerbal Joint Reinforcement - 3.1.4
KSP-AVC Plugin - 1.1.5
Docking Port Alignment Indicator - 6.2
NearFutureConstruction - 0.5.5
NearFutureElectrical - 0.6.2
NearFuturePropulsion - 0.6.1
NearFutureSolar - 0.5.5
NearFutureSpacecraft - 0.4.4
Final Frontier - 0.9.8.1882
Outer Planets Mod - 1.9.2
PlanetShine - 0.2.4.2
RCS Build Aid - 0.7.7
SCANsat - 1.1.4.9
SETI-Contracts - 0.9.6.1
Sigma: Binary - 1.4.9
Sigma: OPM Tilt - 1.2
SmartParts - 1.6.6
StationPartsExpansion - 0.3.4
StockPlugins - 1.1.1
Strategia - 1.1.1
Kerbal Alarm Clock - 3.5
Transfer Window Planner - 1.4
USI Core - 0.1.8
Kolonization Core - 0.1.10
USI-LS - 0.3.15
MKS-LITE - 0.3.3
Universal Storage - 1.1.0.10
Unmanned before Manned - 1.0.5.1
[x] Science! - 4.14

The usual, from your log:

d3d: failed to create 2D texture id=11281 w=2560 h=1600 mips=1 d3dfmt=22 [out of memory]

Probably means what it says. Either you have too many texture-heavy mods, or something is leaking badly.

Might want to look into the log spam issue too. I see a bunch of missing assembly errors mentioning KSPUtil, as well as errors from PlanetShine and ModuleLifeSupport (USITools isn't loading?). Far too much (100MB+!) mod-induced noise in that log to make sense of. I'd start with checking all mods are the correct versions (1.1 mods will not run on 1.0.5 for example), and check you haven't missed any dependencies.

---

You also appear to have mods installed that are not on your list, maybe pulled in as dependencies - DistantObjectEnhancement and BoulderCo (Environmental Visual Enhancements) at a glance (or at least textures from those mods), but again, too much noise in that log to make much sense of.

Edited April 8, 2016 by steve_v
What are EVE textures doing in there?
What is KSPUtil, anyways? It doesn't seem to be a mod?
